URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5046
 
 
   This patch fixes the following build failures with Xcode projects generated with the `-G Xcode` option for Cmake:
   
   * Link failure with libtest
   * Cmake error with `ARROW_GANDIVA_JAVA`

hatemhelal commented on issue #5046: ARROW-5638: [C++][CMake] Fixes for xcode project builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5046#issuecomment-519865161
 
 
   Sure I think I just did this: 
   ```
   git clone https://github.com/apache/arrow.git
   cd arrow
   brew update && brew bundle --file=cpp/Brewfile
   ```
   [copied from here]((https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/docs/source/developers/cpp.rst))
   
   Then with the default dependency source ("`AUTO`") it should find the system installed versions.

   I see that the lz4_ep fails to build in the Xcode project with the following syndrome:

   I see that the lz4_ep fails to build in the Xcode project with the following syndrome:
   
   ```
   ...
   compiling static library
   compiling dynamic library 1.8.3
   ld: unknown option: -soname=liblz4.so.1
   clang: error: linker command failed with exit code 1 (use -v to see invocation)
   make[2]: *** [liblz4.so.1.8.3] Error 1
   make[1]: *** [lib-release] Error 2
   ```
   Which won't ever work on macOS...

hatemhelal commented on issue #5046: ARROW-5638: [C++][CMake] Fixes for xcode project builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5046#issuecomment-519875693
 
 
   I think I found the problem with the lz4_ep.  The makefile for building the shared library checks for the OS like this (see [lz4/lib/Makefile](https://github.com/lz4/lz4/blob/v1.8.3/lib/Makefile#L48))
   
   ```
   OS ?= $(shell uname)
   ```
   
   which I think is necessary to support cross-compiling.  The test for `OS == "Darwin"` fails since the Xcode driven build appears to have `OS` set to `MACOS` so we could patch the above line to force invoking `uname` to correctly infer that we really are on a `Darwin` machine:
   
   ```
   OS := $(shell uname)
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #5046: ARROW-5638: [C++][CMake] Fixes for xcode project builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5046#discussion_r312643032
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/cmake_modules/ThirdpartyToolchain.cmake
 ##########
 @@ -1469,6 +1469,14 @@ macro(build_gtest)
     set(GTEST_CMAKE_ARGS ${GTEST_CMAKE_ARGS} "-DCMAKE_MACOSX_RPATH:BOOL=ON")
   endif()
 
+  if(CMAKE_GENERATOR STREQUAL "Xcode")
+    # Xcode projects support multi-configuration builds.  This forces the gtest build
+    # to use the same output directory as a single-configuration Makefile driven build.
+    set(GTEST_CMAKE_ARGS
+        ${GTEST_CMAKE_ARGS} "-DCMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY=${_GTEST_LIBRARY_DIR}"
+        "-DCMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE}=${_GTEST_RUNTIME_DIR}")
 
 Review comment:
   Could you use `list(APPEND GTEST_CMAKE_ARGS ...)`?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kou commented on pull request #5046: ARROW-5638: [C++][CMake] Fixes for xcode project builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5046#discussion_r312644788
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -395,6 +395,14 @@ set(LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
 # where to put generated binaries
 set(EXECUTABLE_OUTPUT_PATH "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
 
+if(CMAKE_GENERATOR STREQUAL Xcode)
+  # Xcode projects support multi-configuration builds.  This forces a single output directory
+  # when building with Xcode that is consistent with single-configuration Makefile driven build.
+  set(CMAKE_ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE} "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
+  set(CMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE} "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
+  set(CMAKE_RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE} "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
+endif()
 
 Review comment:
   I think that we can always set these variables.
   
   We should use `UPPERCASE_BUILD_TYPE` instead of `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE` because users may specify `Debug` as `CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE`.
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

hatemhelal commented on pull request #5046: ARROW-5638: [C++][CMake] Fixes for xcode project builds
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5046#discussion_r314437638
 
 

 ##########
 File path: cpp/CMakeLists.txt
 ##########
 @@ -395,6 +395,14 @@ set(LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
 # where to put generated binaries
 set(EXECUTABLE_OUTPUT_PATH "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
 
+if(CMAKE_GENERATOR STREQUAL Xcode)
+  # Xcode projects support multi-configuration builds.  This forces a single output directory
+  # when building with Xcode that is consistent with single-configuration Makefile driven build.
+  set(CMAKE_ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE} "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
+  set(CMAKE_LIBRARY_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE} "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
+  set(CMAKE_RUNTIME_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CMAKE_BUILD_TYPE} "${BUILD_OUTPUT_ROOT_DIRECTORY}")
+endif()
 
 Review comment:
   > I think that we can always set these variables.
   
   I'm a bit worried about settings these variables unconditionally and possibly breaking multi-configuration generators (MSVC?).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++] cmake fails to generate Xcode project when Gandiva JNI bindings are enabled

comments.body: I'm not familiar enough with cmake to make sense of the {{INTERFACE_INCLUDE_DIRECTORIES}} error message but this seems to be a latent problem with trying to combine the Xcode project generator with the Gandiva JNI option.
